meanings.definition: A ruler who has absolute power
meanings.sent1: The autocrats in the ancient kingdom made all the decisions without asking anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The autocrats of the past often controlled every aspect of their subjects' lives.
meanings.sent3: The autocrats at the meeting insisted on choosing the lunch menu for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The autocrats of the business world dominate their industries with unwavering control.
meanings.sent5: The image of autocrats sitting on golden thrones symbolizes power and authority.

meanings.definition: A person who behaves in an authoritarian manner
meanings.sent1: The teacher was known as an autocrat because she never allowed any discussion in class.
meanings.sent2: Some managers can become autocrats, making all decisions without considering others' opinions.
meanings.sent3: The autocrat of the household insisted on a strict schedule for everyone to follow.
meanings.sent4: She was an autocrat when it came to organizing events, ensuring everything went according to her plan.
meanings.sent5: The autocrat boss micromanaged every task, leaving no room for independent work.
